content: single_crochet in next st * 5 times =40 sts round 11 1 single_crochet in each st around = 40 sts round 12 *1 single_crochet in each of next 4 sts 2 single_crochet in next st * 8 times =48 sts round 13 *1 single_crochet in each of next 7 sts 2 single_crochet in next st * 6 times =54 sts fasten_off leaving a long tail for sewing - stuff with fiberfill sew botty to the hat s back beginning approximately in round 3 or 4 of the hat funny-rooster-parts the following parts have to be worked like stated in the „funny rooster instructions link see above - feet in orange and leave a long tail for dewing - wattle in red - beak in yellow & 1 2 rds more than indicated in the „funny rooster pattern - eyes in white - comb in red - wings in white sew all parts to the earflap hat resp the chicken s head ©2017 anja welling find wilma spielen on facebook wordpress and ravelry 8 wilmaspielen wordpress com - www facebook com/wilma spielen 980 - http //www ravelry com/people/wilmaspielen i hope you enjoyed this pattern and btw i d love to see the results of your chicken work please share photos of your finished creation directly on my facebook page or email me and if you find such a good sport like my hubby who will dare to be your canvas and wear the hat in public please share the photos - i hope to see you soon  contact info my blog https //wilmaspielen wordpress com facebook https //www facebook com/wilma spielen 980 ravelry http //www ravelry com/people/wilmaspielen copyright notes ©2017 anjawelling aka wilma spielen you are welcome to hand make items from my patterns for non-commercial use - however i respectfully request that you do not attempt to claim my patterns and/or designs as your own designs please clearly credit all designs to anja welling and/or wilma spielen and provide a link to either my facebook page https //www facebook com/wilma spielen 980 my ravelry account http //www ravelry com/people/wilmaspielen or my wordpress blog https //wilmaspielen wordpress com also please do not reproduce any part of my patterns anywhere i work very hard to design and write these patterns so encountering plagiarism and/or reproduction of my patterns would be extremely discouraging and hurtful thank you so much for your understanding and happy crocheting  ©2017 anja welling find wilma spielen on facebook wordpress and ravelry 9 wilmaspielen wordpress com -
